abstract: Committee members of 2015 Tony Awards nominate just a few of 35 new Broadway productions, with majority of nominations going to musicals An American in Paris, Fun Home and Something Rotten!; Broadway boosters worry that, with such limited nominations, there may not be enough star power to lure audience to June Tony Awards broadcast.
lead_paragraph: The musicals “An American in Paris” and “Fun Home” tied for the most nominations, 12, with 10 for “Something Rotten!”

headline.main: Tony Nominations 2015: ‘An American in Paris’ and ‘Fun Home’ Emerge as Favorites
headline.print_headline: Tonys Smile on a Few Musicals

snippet: The musicals “An American in Paris” and “Fun Home” tied for the most nominations, 12, with 10 for “Something Rotten!”
